meanings.definition: A thing made to be similar or identical to another.
meanings.sent1: She made a copy of the drawing for her friend.
meanings.sent2: The teacher handed out copies of the worksheet to the students.
meanings.sent3: The copy of the painting looked so real, it fooled everyone!
meanings.sent4: Her laugh was a perfect copy of her mother's infectious giggle.
meanings.sent5: The copy of the key was so well-made, it fit perfectly in the lock.

meanings.definition: An imitation or reproduction of an original.
meanings.sent1: He bought a copy of the famous painting to hang in his living room.
meanings.sent2: The store sells copies of designer handbags at a fraction of the price.
meanings.sent3: The copy of the movie was so bad, it became a comedy in itself.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a copy of the Mona Lisa's mysterious expression.
meanings.sent5: The copy of the song was so well-done, it sounded just like the original.

meanings.definition: To make a similar or identical version of something.
meanings.sent1: She will copy the recipe to share with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to copy the famous painting as a tribute.
meanings.sent3: He tried to copy his friend's dance moves but ended up looking silly.
meanings.sent4: The student tried to copy the answer from his neighbor but got caught.
meanings.sent5: She wanted to copy the success of her role model and become a famous singer.
